data.description: A tool for mapping and visualizing project structures and relationships. Project Mapper analyzes codebases to create structural maps and identify relationships between different components, helping developers understand complex projects quickly. Key features:

modules.description: Module entry point when run as python -m
Module entry point when run as python -m

models.name: TestModel
models.description: Test model with Location field.

models.name: TestModel
models.description: Test model for BaseModel tests.

models.name: PipelineContext
models.description: Context object for sharing data between pipeline stages.

models.name: ConfigurationSchema
models.description:
Schema for validating configuration data.

    This schema defines the structure and validation rules for Project Mapper configuration.

models.name: GeneratorConfig
models.description:
Configuration for map generation.
    
    Attributes:
        include_code: Whether to include code elements in the map
        include_documentation: Whether to include documentation elements in the map
        include_metadata: Whether to include metadata in the map
        enable_chunking: Whether to enable chunking for large maps
        max_tokens: Maximum token estimate (0 for no limit)
        ai_optimize: Whether to apply AI optimization
        format_type: The format type for the map

models.name: PipelineContext
models.description: Context object passed between pipeline stages.

models.name: RelationshipMapper
models.description: Maps relationships between code and documentation elements.

models.name: RelationshipMappingStage
models.description: Pipeline stage that maps relationships between code and documentation elements.

models.name: CallContext
models.description: Context information for a function call.

models.name: ScopeInfo
models.description: Information about the current scope.

models.name: Relationship
models.description:
Model for a relationship between two elements.

    The Relationship class models a relationship between a source and a target
    element, with a confidence score and optional metadata.

models.name: Relationship
models.description: A relationship between two elements.

models.name: ProjectMap
models.description:
Represents a complete project map.

    Attributes:
        project: The project this map represents
        files: List of discovered files
        code_analysis: Results of code analysis
        doc_analysis: Results of documentation analysis
        relationships: Detected relationships
        metadata: Additional metadata about the map

models.name: AnalysisResult
models.description:
Base class for all analysis results.
    
    Analysis results contain the extracted information from a file.

models.name: AnalysisResultCollection
models.description:
Collection of analysis results.
    
    This class represents the combined results of analyzing multiple files.

models.name: DocumentationElement
models.description: A documentation element found in the codebase.

models.name: DocumentationReference
models.description:
Represents a reference from a documentation element to another resource.
    
    This can be a reference to code, another documentation element, or an external resource.

models.name: DiscoveredFile
models.description: Represents a file discovered in the project.

models.name: DiscoveredProject
models.description: Represents a discovered project with its files and metadata.

models.name: Location
models.description:
Location in the codebase.
    
    Defines a starting and ending position in a file.

models.name: LocationModel
models.description: Pydantic model for Location.

models.name: CodeReference
models.description: Represents a reference from one code element to another.

models.name: CodeElement
models.description: Represents a code element such as a class, function, or variable.

models.name: CodeElement
models.description:
A code element found in the codebase.
    
    This is a legacy dataclass version maintained for backward compatibility.

top_imports.package: AST nodes and converting them to string representations
the pipeline context and generates various maps

recommendations: Fix linting errors to improve code quality
Address style violations to improve code consistency
Add more comments to improve code documentation

agent_classes.name: Analyzer

methods.name: can_analyze
methods.docstring:
Check if this analyzer can analyze the given file.

Args:
    file: The file to check
    
Returns:
    True if this analyzer can handle the file

methods.name: get_file_filter
methods.docstring:
Get file patterns for selecting files for this analyzer.

Returns:
    List of glob patterns for files this analyzer can handle

agent_classes.docstring:
Base class for all analyzers.

An analyzer is responsible for analyzing a specific type of file,
such as Python code, JavaScript code, Markdown documentation, etc.

agent_classes.name: AnalyzerRegistry

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring: Initialize an empty analyzer registry.

methods.name: register_analyzer
methods.docstring:
Register an analyzer class.

Args:
    analyzer_class: The analyzer class to register

methods.name: get_analyzer
methods.docstring:
Get an analyzer class by name.

Args:
    name: Name of the analyzer to get
    
Returns:
    The analyzer class, or None if not found

methods.name: get_analyzer_for_file
methods.docstring:
Get an analyzer for the specified file.

Args:
    file: The file to get an analyzer for
    
Returns:
    An analyzer that can analyze the file, or None if not found

agent_classes.docstring:
Registry for analyzer classes.

This class provides a way to register and retrieve analyzers.

agent_classes.name: AnalyzerFactory

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring:
Initialize an analyzer factory.

Args:
    registry: Optional analyzer registry to use (creates a new one if None)

methods.name: get_analyzer_for_file
methods.docstring:
Get an appropriate analyzer for the given file.

Args:
    file: The file to get an analyzer for
    
Returns:
    An analyzer instance if a suitable analyzer is found, None otherwise

agent_classes.docstring:
Factory for creating appropriate analyzers.

This class provides a way to create analyzers for specific files.

agent_classes.name: PythonAnalyzer

methods.name: can_analyze
methods.docstring:
Check if this analyzer can handle the given file.

Args:
    file: The file to check
    
Returns:
    True if this analyzer can handle the file

methods.name: get_file_filter
methods.docstring:
Get file patterns for selecting Python files.

Returns:
    List of glob patterns for Python files

methods.name: analyze_file
methods.docstring:
Analyze a Python file and extract code elements.

Args:
    file_path: Path to the file
    content: File content
    
Returns:
    List of extracted code elements

methods.name: analyze
methods.docstring:
Analyze a Python file.

Args:
    file: The file to analyze
    
Returns:
    Analysis results or None if analysis failed

agent_classes.docstring: Analyzer for Python files.

agent_classes.name: NodeProcessors

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring:
Initialize the node processors.

Args:
    visitor: The AST visitor that will use these processors

methods.name: process_class_def
methods.docstring:
Process a class definition.

Args:
    node: The class definition node

methods.name: process_function_def
methods.docstring:
Process a function definition.

Args:
    node: The function definition node

methods.name: process_async_function_def
methods.docstring:
Process an async function definition.

Args:
    node: The async function definition node

methods.name: _process_function
methods.docstring:
Process a function or method definition.

Args:
    node: The function definition node
    is_async: Whether this is an async function

methods.name: process_import
methods.docstring:
Process an import statement.

Args:
    node: The import statement node

methods.name: process_import_from
methods.docstring:
Process an import from statement.

Args:
    node: The import from statement node

methods.name: process_assign
methods.docstring:
Process an assignment statement.

Args:
    node: The assignment statement node

methods.name: process_ann_assign
methods.docstring:
Process an annotated assignment statement.

Args:
    node: The annotated assignment statement node

agent_classes.docstring:
Processors for different AST node types.

This class contains methods for processing different types of AST nodes
and extracting code elements from them.

agent_classes.name: MarkdownAnalyzer

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring: Initialize the Markdown analyzer.

methods.name: can_analyze
methods.docstring:
Check if this analyzer can analyze the given file.

Args:
    file: The file to check
    
Returns:
    True if this is a Markdown file, False otherwise

methods.name: get_file_filter
methods.docstring:
Get file patterns for selecting Markdown files.

Returns:
    List of glob patterns for Markdown files

methods.name: analyze_file
methods.docstring:
Analyze a Markdown file and extract documentation elements.

Args:
    file_path: Path to the file
    content: File content
    
Returns:
    List of extracted documentation elements

methods.name: analyze
methods.docstring:
Analyze a Markdown file and extract document structure.

Args:
    file: The file to analyze
    content: Optional file content (if already loaded)
    
Returns:
    Analysis results with extracted documentation elements
    
Raises:
    ValueError: If the file cannot be analyzed

methods.name: _analyze_references
methods.docstring:
Analyze elements to detect references.

Args:
    elements: List of documentation elements to analyze

agent_classes.docstring:
Analyzer for Markdown documentation files.

This class analyzes Markdown files and extracts document structure elements
like headings, sections, code blocks, and references.

agent_classes.name: AnalyzerFactory

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring: Initialize the analyzer factory.

methods.name: _register_analyzers
methods.docstring: Register all available analyzers.

methods.name: get_analyzer_for_file
methods.docstring:
Get an appropriate analyzer for the given file.

Args:
    file: The file to get an analyzer for
    
Returns:
    An analyzer instance or None if no suitable analyzer is found

methods.name: create_analyzer
methods.docstring:
Create an analyzer by name.

Args:
    analyzer_name: The name of the analyzer to create (e.g., 'python', 'markdown')
    
Returns:
    An analyzer instance or None if no suitable analyzer is found

agent_classes.docstring:
Factory for creating analyzers.

This class is responsible for creating the appropriate analyzer for a given file.

agent_classes.name: ProjectManager

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring:
Initialize the project manager.

Args:
    config: Optional configuration object

methods.name: analyze_project
methods.docstring:
Analyze a project and generate a project map.

Args:
    project_path: Path to the project root

Returns:
    Generated project map

Raises:
    ValueError: If project path is invalid

methods.name: update_map
methods.docstring:
Update an existing project map.

Args:
    project_path: Path to the project root

Returns:
    Updated project map

Raises:
    ValueError: If project path is invalid

methods.name: update_project
methods.docstring:
Update an existing project map.

Args:
    project_path: Path to the project root
    full: If True, perform a full re-analysis of the project

Returns:
    Updated project map

methods.name: _create_pipeline
methods.docstring:
Create the analysis pipeline.

Returns:
    Configured pipeline instance

agent_classes.docstring:
Main entry point for the Project Mapper system.

The ProjectManager coordinates the analysis process and manages the overall workflow.

agent_classes.name: AnalysisResult
agent_classes.docstring:
Base class for all analysis results.

Analysis results contain the extracted information from a file.

agent_classes.name: CodeAnalysisResult

methods.name: add_element
methods.docstring:
Add a code element to the result.

Args:
    element: The code element to add

methods.name: get_elements_by_type
methods.docstring:
Get elements of a specific type.

Args:
    element_type: The element type to filter by
    
Returns:
    List of elements matching the type

methods.name: add_import
methods.docstring:
Add an import statement to the result.

Args:
    import_from: Module imported from (None for direct imports)
    import_what: What was imported
    alias: Optional alias for the import

agent_classes.docstring:
Analysis result for code files.

Contains extracted code elements from a file.

agent_classes.name: DocumentationAnalysisResult

methods.name: add_element
methods.docstring:
Add a documentation element to the result.

Args:
    element: The documentation element to add

methods.name: get_elements_by_type
methods.docstring:
Get elements of a specific type.

Args:
    element_type: The element type to filter by
    
Returns:
    List of elements matching the type

methods.name: get_sections
methods.docstring:
Get all section elements.

Returns:
    List of section elements

agent_classes.docstring:
Analysis result for documentation files.

Contains extracted documentation elements from a file.

agent_classes.name: CodeElement

methods.name: add_child
methods.docstring:
Add a child element to this element.

Args:
    child_id: Identifier of the child element

methods.name: add_reference
methods.docstring:
Add a reference to another element.

Args:
    reference_type: Type of the reference (code, doc, external)
    reference_id: Identifier of the referenced element
    location: Location information for the reference (optional)
    context: Context around the reference (optional)
    confidence: Confidence score for this reference
    metadata: Additional metadata for the reference (optional)

agent_classes.docstring:
A code element found in the codebase.

This is a legacy dataclass version maintained for backward compatibility.

agent_classes.name: TokenizationEstimator

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring:
Initialize the token estimator.

Args:
    chars_per_token: Average characters per token (GPT models average ~4)

methods.name: estimate_tokens
methods.docstring:
Estimate the number of tokens in the data.

Args:
    data: The data to estimate tokens for
    
Returns:
    Estimated token count

methods.name: _estimate_string_tokens
methods.docstring:
Estimate the number of tokens in a string.

Args:
    text: The string to estimate tokens for
    
Returns:
    Estimated token count

methods.name: _estimate_dict_tokens
methods.docstring:
Estimate the number of tokens in a dictionary.

Args:
    data: The dictionary to estimate tokens for
    
Returns:
    Estimated token count

methods.name: _estimate_sequence_tokens
methods.docstring:
Estimate the number of tokens in a sequence.

Args:
    data: The sequence to estimate tokens for
    
Returns:
    Estimated token count

agent_classes.docstring:
Estimator for token counts in AI models.

This class provides methods for estimating the number of tokens that
different data structures will consume in AI models.

agent_classes.name: AIOptimizer

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring:
Initialize the AI optimizer.

Args:
    config: The generator configuration

methods.name: optimize_map
methods.docstring:
Optimize a map structure for AI consumption.

Args:
    map_structure: The map structure to optimize
    
Returns:
    The optimized map structure

methods.name: _optimize_code_elements
methods.docstring:
Optimize code elements for AI consumption.

Args:
    map_structure: The map structure to optimize
    
Returns:
    The optimized map structure

methods.name: _optimize_documentation_elements
methods.docstring:
Optimize documentation elements for AI consumption.

Args:
    map_structure: The map structure to optimize
    
Returns:
    The optimized map structure

methods.name: _optimize_relationships
methods.docstring:
Optimize relationships for AI consumption.

Args:
    map_structure: The map structure to optimize
    
Returns:
    The optimized map structure

methods.name: _add_ai_metadata
methods.docstring:
Add AI-specific metadata to the map.

Args:
    map_structure: The map structure to augment
    
Returns:
    The augmented map structure

agent_classes.docstring:
Optimizer for AI model consumption.

This class provides methods for optimizing map structures to be more
efficiently consumed by AI models.

agent_classes.name: GeneratorConfig

methods.name: to_dict
methods.docstring:
Convert the config to a serializable dictionary.

Returns:
    A dictionary representation of this config

agent_classes.docstring:
Configuration for map generation.

Attributes:
    include_code: Whether to include code elements in the map
    include_documentation: Whether to include documentation elements in the map
    include_metadata: Whether to include metadata in the map
    enable_chunking: Whether to enable chunking for large maps
    max_tokens: Maximum token estimate (0 for no limit)
    ai_optimize: Whether to apply AI optimization
    format_type: The format type for the map

agent_classes.name: RelationshipDetector

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring:
Initialize the relationship detector with default rules.

Args:
    config_manager: Optional configuration manager

methods.name: add_rule
methods.docstring:
Add a relationship detection rule.

Args:
    rule: The rule to add

methods.name: detect_relationships
methods.docstring:
Detect relationships between a source element and multiple target elements.

Args:
    source_element: The source element
    target_elements: List of potential target elements
    
Returns:
    List of detected relationships

methods.name: detect_all_relationships
methods.docstring:
Detect all relationships between the given code and documentation elements.

Args:
    code_elements: List of code elements
    doc_elements: List of documentation elements
    
Returns:
    List of all detected relationships

agent_classes.docstring:
Main component for detecting relationships between elements.

This detector manages a set of relationship rules and applies them to detect
relationships between code and documentation elements.

agent_classes.name: FunctionCallAnalyzer

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring:
Initialize the analyzer.

Args:
    code: Python source code to analyze

methods.name: analyze
methods.docstring:
Analyze the code and return found function calls.

Returns:
    List of CallContext objects representing function calls

methods.name: visit_FunctionDef
methods.docstring:
Visit a function definition node.

Args:
    node: AST node for function definition

methods.name: visit_Call
methods.docstring:
Visit a function call node.

Args:
    node: AST node for function call

methods.name: visit_Import
methods.docstring:
Visit an import node.

Args:
    node: AST node for import statement

methods.name: visit_ImportFrom
methods.docstring:
Visit an import from node.

Args:
    node: AST node for import from statement

methods.name: _analyze_call
methods.docstring:
Analyze a function call node.

Args:
    node: AST node for function call
    
Returns:
    CallContext if a valid function call is found, None otherwise

methods.name: _analyze_attribute_call
methods.docstring:
Analyze an attribute-based function call.

Args:
    node: AST attribute node representing the function call
    
Returns:
    CallContext if a valid method call is found, None otherwise

methods.name: _create_call_context
methods.docstring:
Create a call context object.

Args:
    callee_name: Name of the called function
    line_number: Line number of the call
    confidence: Confidence score for the call
    is_method_call: Whether this is a method call
    qualifier: Qualifier for method calls (e.g., object name)
    
Returns:
    CallContext object with call information

methods.name: _get_line_context
methods.docstring:
Get context lines around a specific line.

Args:
    line_number: Target line number
    before: Whether to get context before (True) or after (False)
    context_lines: Number of context lines to include
    
Returns:
    String containing the context lines

methods.name: _get_attribute_chain
methods.docstring:
Get the full chain of attributes.

Args:
    node: AST attribute node
    
Returns:
    String representing the attribute chain

methods.name: _is_method
methods.docstring:
Check if a function definition is a method.

Args:
    node: AST function definition node
    
Returns:
    True if the function is a method, False otherwise

methods.name: _is_classmethod
methods.docstring:
Check if a function definition is a classmethod.

Args:
    node: AST function definition node
    
Returns:
    True if the function is a classmethod, False otherwise

agent_classes.docstring: AST visitor for analyzing function calls in Python code.

agent_classes.name: ConfidenceScorer

methods.name: __init__
methods.docstring: Initialize with default scoring strategies.

methods.name: add_strategy
methods.docstring:
Add a scoring strategy.

Args:
    strategy: The strategy to add

methods.name: score_relationship
methods.docstring:
Score a single relationship using all strategies.

Args:
    relationship: The relationship to score
    
Returns:
    The relationship with updated confidence score

methods.name: score_relationships
methods.docstring:
Score a list of relationships.

Args:
    relationships: The relationships to score
    
Returns:
    The relationships with updated confidence scores

methods.name: get_explanation
methods.docstring:
Get a human-readable explanation of the scoring.

Args:
    relationship: The relationship to explain
    
Returns:
    A string explaining how the confidence was calculated

agent_classes.docstring:
Main component for scoring relationship confidence.

This scorer manages a set of scoring strategies and applies them to adjust
the confidence scores of relationships.
